content.description: Certain bacteria can use both ethyl alcohol and acetate as sources of nutrients. In an experiment where both nutrients are available to a bacterial population, the following results were obtained and graphed.
content.question: What additional procedure would best help determine whether these movements are due to active transport or to passive transport?

choices.label: Repeat the original experiment, but at three different temperatures. Compare the transport rates among the three temperatures.
Repeat the original experiment, but add a substance known to block movement of molecules across aquaporins. Compare the rates on the two graphs.
Use two additional treatments, one containing only ethyl alcohol and one containing only acetate. Compare the graphs of these two treatments with the original graph.

Use two additional treatments, one containing only ethyl alcohol and one containing only acetate. Include a substance known to block <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> use by the plasma membrane. Compare the graphs of these two treatments to the original graph.

content.answer: Use two additional treatments, one containing only ethyl alcohol and one containing only acetate. Include a substance known to block <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> use by the plasma membrane. Compare the graphs of these two treatments to the original graph.
